alert.note: Alert for Allegheny; Armstrong; Beaver; Butler; Fayette; Fayette Ridges; Indiana; Lawrence; Mercer; Washington; Westmoreland; Westmoreland Ridges (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 13 at 5:11PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...SNOW SHOWERS WILL AFFECT SOUTHEASTERN MERCER...NORTHEASTERN BEAVER...EAST CENTRAL WASHINGTON...CENTRAL LAWRENCE...BUTLER... SOUTHWESTERN INDIANA...ALLEGHENY...WESTMORELAND...SOUTHWESTERN ARMSTRONG AND FAYETTE COUNTIES... At 510 PM EDT, snow showers were located along a line extending from New Castle to Mars to Munhall to near West Newton to near Farmington. Movement was east at 25 mph. Locations impacted include... Pittsburgh, Penn Hills, Mount Lebanon, Bethel Park, Ross Township, McCandless Township, Monroeville, Cranberry, New Castle, Greensburg, McKeesport, and Butler. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 39 and 57. Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 15 and 99. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 71 and 111. Parkway North between mile markers 1 and 13. Interstate 376 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 12 and 21, and between mile markers 68 and 84. Snow will lead to reduced visibilities and worsen travel conditions. Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this intense snow shower. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads are likely to lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
